channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-16750] Kerberized YARN on Docker test fails due to stalling Hadoop cluster
item.description:

item.summary: Kerberized YARN on Docker test fails due to stalling Hadoop cluster

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: aljoscha could you take a look at this problem?

> What does "staring Hadoop cluster" mean?

gjy, the above logs show the info "Error: Could not start hadoop cluster" after retrying some time. I am not quite sure the root cause of it.
rmetzger I think this is another problem with the new Azure setup, I seem to remember that there where other problems with this test on Azure, right?

Yes, there were other problems. The problem was that AZP machines have pretty large disks (80GB), but only 15GB are available. Since we are downloading maven artifacts, docker images + we are producing logs etc., the disk was less than 10% free when the YARN tests were running.
That's why YARN's NodeManagers declared themselves as "my disk is full", the test could not schedule anything on those NodeManagers.

In above logs, we seem to have 40GB of disk space available. That should be more than enough. I believe we are facing a different issue here.

I think rmetzger is right. The failed case is not because of disk problems.

However, since we do not print the logs of YARN cluster when start YARN cluster failed. It will be very difficult to dig into and find the root cause. I will update the e2e tests to fix the logs and run more times to reproduce this problem.
fly_in_gis I've assigned you to this ticket in order to add more debug logs.

trohrmann Since i could not reproduce this problem on my azure pipeline(more than 10 times), i have attached a PR to add the debug logs. Then when it reproduces in the flink azure pipeline, we could dig into the logs and find out the root cause.

WDYT?

Merged commit which enables more logging in case of failures: 56d7f5307420558bff520919236565b92a8b9ce7

Let's wait until this problem re-occurs and then we hopefully figure out what's going wrong.
Closed after having merged some debug commits. Please re-open this issue if the problem occurs again (hopefully with better debug output).
